articles.title: Ready or not, enterprises are betting on AI
articles.description: This has been a big week for AI companies signing enterprise deals, with Zendesk unveiling new AI agents that are supposed to be able to resolve 80% of customer service issues, Anthropic and IBM announcing a strategic partnership, and Deloitte also announcing a deal with Anthropic.

articles.title: Update: Two injured in crash involving police vehicle responding to arrest of robbery suspect
articles.description: Injuries from the collision were minor. The robbery suspect was apprehended, while officers used spray to control the dog that was with him.

articles.title: Mississippi school homecoming celebrations turn deadly as 6 people are killed in separate shootings
articles.description: High school homecoming celebrations in Mississippi ended in gunfire, with two separate shootings on opposite sides of the state Friday night that left at least six people dead and many more injured, authorities said. articles.title: Soldiers from elite Capsat unit join protests against Madagascar’s president
articles.description: Demonstrators march alongside regiment, who earlier in the day said they would not fire on the crowdsMadagascar’s prime minister called for calm after an elite group of soldiers joined thousands of protesters against the country’s president on the streets of the capital on Saturday afternoon.Protest

articles.title: Prince Harry and Meghan call out the harmful effects of social media on today’s youth
articles.description: Prince Harry and Meghan spoke about the dangers of social media at a gala and festival in New York.

articles.title: Trump fires back at China’s rare earth mineral restrictions by threatening 100% tariffs
articles.description: President Donald Trump declared Friday that he will impose a 100% tariff on all imports from China, while also imposing export controls on “any and all critical software” from the United States.

articles.title: ’Shovel Superman”: Edmonton man uses vacation to help clean up floods in Taiwan
articles.description: HUALIEN CITY, Taiwan — While many people like to spend their vacations on the beach or at resorts, Jaron Rosso Wiigs of Edmonton used some of his days off to shovel mud after a typhoon in Taiwan. articles.description: There were no injuries following the apparent gunfight on Victoria Street

articles.title: Rankin aims to keep Elks’ playoff hopes alive on Saturday against Blue Bombers
articles.description: EDMONTON — Through the first eight games of the Edmonton Elks season, running back Justin Rankin averaged 5.2 yards a carry for 308 yards, twice was held to zero yards in a game, and scored just two touchdowns. articles.title: It’s not too late for Apple to get AI right
articles.description: Apple still has a shot at leading the AI-powered app era. As OpenAI launches its ChatGPT app platform, Apple’s smarter Siri and deep ecosystem could keep it ahead.

articles.title: Lenovo Yoga Pro 9i 16 Review: A True MacBook Pro Rival?
articles.description: No Windows laptop is dethroning the MacBook Pro anytime soon, but the Yoga Pro 9i 16 gets surprisingly close.

articles.title: Scientists unearth a 112-million-year-old time capsule filled with ancient insects
articles.description: Researchers have unearthed South America’s first amber deposits containing ancient insects in an Ecuadorian quarry, offering a rare 112-million-year-old glimpse into life on the supercontinent Gondwana. articles.title: Australia’s March Toward 100 Percent Clean Energy
articles.description: The country’s grid operator says shifting from coal to clean power is not only possible but inevitable. The work there could provide a road map for other countries.

articles.title: A million-sun-mass mystery object found lurking in deep space
articles.description: Scientists using a global array of radio telescopes have detected the universe’s lowest-mass dark object by observing how it warped light through gravitational lensing. The invisible mass, about a million times the Sun’s weight, could be a small clump of dark matter or a dormant dwarf galaxy. The fi

articles.title: Breakthrough compounds may reverse nerve damage caused by multiple sclerosis
articles.description: Researchers have identified two compounds, K102 and K110, that could repair the nerve damage from multiple sclerosis. articles.description: Intergovernmental Affairs Minister Dominic LeBlanc said both leaders had directed their teams to 'quickly land deals'
